definition: ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only
ability/talent/sb of a certain type/a capable individual/only/only then/just now
a moment ago/just now/(indicating sth happening later than expected)/(preceded by a clause of condition or reason) not until/(followed by a numerical clause) only

sentences.english: Who make you mushroom so late, the whole ruddy blood temple you this hour equitable obtain up.
sentences.chinese: 谁让你起得这么晚，整个赤血宫就你这个时辰才起床。

sentences.english: It was in this context that international support and scrutiny were critical.
sentences.chinese: 正因为是在这种情况下，国际援助和监督才很重要。

sentences.english: The only time its okay to use your fingers is when it's a fish bone.
sentences.chinese: 只有在吃鱼的时候，才可以用手去捏鱼骨头。

sentences.english: The four-letter words were always edited out of radio scripts until quite recently.
sentences.chinese: 直到最近广播稿中的庸俗词语才让保留下来。
我们的电子服务才是关键。

sentences.english: It is the great who is assailed by envy.
sentences.chinese: 正是大人物才受到嫉妒的中伤。

sentences.english: What should you do then on those sleepless nights?
sentences.chinese: 那么你在睡不着的夜晚干什么才好呢？

sentences.english: All sounds are still only moments, the mood will be cheerful jump.
sentences.chinese: 只有万籁俱静的时刻，心绪才会欢快的跳跃。

sentences.english: But people are always coming late to operas .
sentences.chinese: 不过人们总是很迟才来看歌剧。

sentences.english: So when I woke up early this morning at 8am it was actually only 7am.
sentences.chinese: 所以，当我早上8点醒来时，实际上才7点钟。

sentences.english: Only humping yourself can you hope to finish your work in time.
sentences.chinese: 只有加把劲干，你才有希望按时完成任务。

sentences.english: This thing is supposed to be a whole number here.
At this time, party boat is a sweet promise only to find the police.
sentences.chinese: 这时，方小舟才发现许嫣然是个警察。

sentences.english: Always get along long before he discovered the great wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 总是相处很久才会发现他的大智慧。

sentences.english: We shouldn't wait for relatives to come to our door before we take care of them.
sentences.chinese: 若论亲戚之间，原该不等上门来就该有照应才是。

sentences.english: The Chinese Exclusion Act was repealed only in 1943.
sentences.chinese: 直到1943年排华法案才被取消。

definition: to wait until/by the time when (sth is ready etc)

at once/right away/only/just (emphasis)/as early as/already/as soon as/then/in that case/as many as/even if/to approach/to move towards/to undertake/to engage in/to suffer/subjected to/to accomplish/to take advantage of/to go with (of foods)/with regard to/concerning
(completed action marker)/(modal particle indicating change of state, situation now)/(modal particle intensifying preceding clause)
to finish/to achieve/variant of 瞭|了[liao3]/to understand clearly
(once) again/also/both... and.../and yet/(used for emphasis) anyway
also/too/(in Classical Chinese) final particle implying affirmation
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
plain/informal/suitable/convenient/opportune/to urinate or defecate/equivalent to 就[jiu4]: then/in that case/even if/soon afterwards
